settings.field_2_text: CDLP is a Swedish design house of focused, luxury essentials developed with innovation. Consciously constructed in Europe using future-oriented materials. Read more

settings.title: Lyocell
settings.field_2_text: The silk-like softness of our products is spelled lyocell. Lyocell is the most sustainable cellulose fabric available, and the ultimate choice for underwear. The fabric is sourced from wood, and refined in a closed-loop system where 99% of the non-toxic solvent used is recycled. Lyocell absorbs dye better than other cellulose fiber, resulting in vibrant colour (and less dye needed). It requires less water than cotton, while providing a softer and more durable quality. The result is breathing, antibacterial underwear that maintains its’ shape, colour and luster.

settings.title: Bamboo
settings.field_2_text: Our socks are made of eco-friendly bamboo yarn, a natural fiber spun from bamboo grass, that lends the fabric luster, flexibility and breathability as well as making the socks naturally anti-bacterial and anti-odeur.

settings.title: Econyl
settings.field_2_text: Our swimwear is made using Econyl—an Italian-sourced premium nylon fibre regenerated from ocean and landfill waste including fishing nets, fabric scraps, and carpets. Through a radical process, the waste is recycled back to its original purity, and can be regenerated infinitely, without ever losing its quality.

settings.title: PES
settings.field_2_text: Our Mobilité underpinnings are crafted from rPET (recycled polyethylene terephthalate), a strong and durable material that is made through recycling existing plastic materials. The fibre is moisture wicking, quick-drying and anti-odor.

settings.title: Lustrous Lyocell
settings.field_2_text: The silk-like softness and luxurious comfort of our Home Collection stems from lustrous woven lyocell–the most sustainable cellulose fabric available. Sourced from wood and refined in a closed-loop system where 99% of the non-toxic solvent used is recycled, lyocell absorbs dye better than other cellulose fiber, resulting in vibrant colour (and less dye needed). It requires less water than conventional cotton, while providing a softer and more durable quality.

settings.title: Ecovero
settings.field_2_text: The airy lightness and natural drape of our Pool collection come from Ecovero; a premium viscose fibre derived from wood pulp. Manufactured only from certified and controlled wood sources, and produced with significantly lower fossil energy use and water than generic viscose, Ecovero is certified with the internationally recognised EU Ecolabel. This label of environmental excellence is only awarded to products and services, which have a significantly lower environmental impact throughout their lifecycle: from raw material extraction to production, distribution and disposal.

settings.title: Organic and Recycled Cotton
settings.field_2_text: Heavy Terry is our re-interpretation of the loopback knit fabric used in classic athletic wear, characterised by loops on the inside and a smooth outer surface. The loops allow air to circulate, and also wick moisture efficiently. Made in a robust 550 gsm weight, in a unique blend of recycled and organic cotton, ensuring the garments maintain shape and comfort.

settings.field_3_text_2: CDLP was founded in 2016 to revolutionize men’s underwear, launching a new generation of products built with intention and purpose. Today, CDLP is a design house of focused luxury essentials within the categories of underwear, tops, swim and pool, performance, and home. Developed with innovation in Sweden, the line is consciously constructed in Europe using future-orientated materials.

settings.field_3_text_2: CDLP is committed to working with future-orientated materials. Our underwear is constructed in lyocell, socks in bamboo, tops in a lyocell and pima cotton blend, performance wear in rPET, and swimwear in Econyl. We work with small scale European suppliers to remedy obsolete products that mass-manufacturing manifests. Our partners are carefully selected based on mutual values to foster long term, sustainable collaboration.
Our products are designed in our Stockholm atelier, where form follows function and understated luxury is key. Timeless design translates to meaningful products and longevity. This is essential.
Our sourcing philosophy seeks to minimize natural resource usage. We look to biodegradable, organic, and recycled fibres before conventional, that originate as close to home as possible.

We are committed to working with future-orientated fabrics (fibre) in our collection. Underwear in lyocell, socks in bamboo, t-shirts in a lyocell and pima cotton blend, performance wear in recycled PES, and swimwear in Econyl—all sourced within Europe.

We champion small scale European production to remedy obsolete products that mass-manufacturing manifests. Our partners are carefully selected based on mutual values, and building long term, sustainable partnerships. Our underwear, swimwear, t-shirts, Home, and Mobilité are crafted in Portugal and our socks are made in Italy. We ensure our partners adhere to responsible social conduct, committed to providing workers safe, clean working conditions and living wages, and together we perform regular audits.

We invest in our customer experience as we believe in providing sustainable purchases. Our loyalty team provides a personalised service for style and product advisory, leading to exceptionally low returned goods and shipping.
As a company, we celebrate diversity, inclusivity, and transparency amongst our growing team members around the world.

settings.field_1_text: Anything to ask? Let us know at help@cdlp.com

settings.field_3_text_2:
For its 2020 resort swimwear collection, CDLP collaborates with Cuixmala, the one-of-its-kind luxury ecological destination set on the Mexican Pacific coast. Celebrating a shared, deep-rooted affinity for responsible practices, the swimwear is crafted from Econyl—an innovative regenerated fibre made from ocean waste. The limited edition collection design is inspired by the vibrant colors and architecture of the property, and includes a Swim Brief, Swim Short, and a Throw, across a palette of Fuchsia/Flame, Maya Blue, and Night Blue/Corazón Red. Worn by Mexican born actor Uriel del Toro and lensed by Mau Sierra.

Bienvenido.

Originally designed as a home for Sir James Goldsmith, who was knighted for his services to environmental conservation, Cuixmala provides the amenities of a 5-star resort balanced with the ambiance of a private estate. A multi-award winner in sustainable tourism, Cuixmala has a long-standing dedication to conservation and wildlife projects including a turtle protection program, an active reforestation program, and extensive recycling programs. It is also a working Hacienda with organic and biodynamic farming that produce the majority of the food that is served on the property.

settings.field_3_text_2: In celebration of the 2020 centennial, CDLP revisits the partnership with Tom of Finland Foundation—the non-profit archive dedicated to the preservation and promotion of Tom of Finland’s work and the erotic arts since 1984—for a limited edition design collaboration. Inspired by the sensuous scenes in Tom's work, CDLP conceives into reality two garments frequently reoccurring in the iconic art—the Tank Top and the Jock Strap.

Tom of Finland (Touko Laaksonen, Finnish, 1920-1991) is recognized as one of the greatest visual innovators of the 20th century and is the creator of some of the most iconic, unrestrained, and readily recognizable imagery of contemporary gay culture. Through his work, Tom unapologetically celebrated male beauty, self-love, and style, fighting against archaic discrimination and sexual oppression. As he confronted the stigmas and stereotypes that burdened homosexual desire, his portrayals of empowered sexuality proved liberating on social and aesthetic levels alike.

settings.field_2_text:
CDLP is a company whose values are grounded in responsibly creating products of highest quality, as well as creating the conditions for people to be inspired and feel fulfilled in their work. We strive to empower our team members to realize their full professional and personal potential and achieve their ambitions by creating a culture that increases their capacity to learn, grow and innovate.

CDLP is a Swedish design house of focused, luxury essentials developed with innovation. Consciously constructed in Europe using future-oriented materials. Founded in 2016 by Christian Larson and Andreas Palm, CDLP has been featured in Vogue, Interview, GQ, Esquire, Monocle, Financial Times, Forbes and The New York Times, and can be found at some of the world’s leading retailers, including Bergdorf Goodman, Browns, END., Harvey Nichols, Lane Crawford, Matchesfashion, Mr Porter and SSENSE.

settings.field_1_text: WE ARE CURRENTLY LOOKING TO EXPAND OUR TEAM WITH THE FOLLOWING POSITIONS
settings.field_2_text: – PRODUCT DEVELOPMENT INTERNSHIP

CDLP is looking for a CRM Manager to join our fast growing, and highly dynamic team at our HQ in Stockholm!

This is a senior role that’s expected to take full ownership and continuously develop the relationship with our customer base.

Meaning to implement, set and execute the CRM strategy of CDLP. Including segmentations of customer base, identifying customer journeys, adjusting communications to each touchpoint, building loyalty program, ultimately increasing CLV and frequency. This role requires both strategic and operational skillset and reports to our E-commerce Director.

The successful applicant will be responsible for the following areas:

– Set, implement and execute CRM strategy.
– Creating segments with customized communications strategies.
– Mapping and identifying customer journeys.
– Main stakeholder towards CRM partner.
– Getting CDLP to the forefront on loyalty initiatives and programs.
– Drive engagement and retainment in all channels.
– Own backlog towards development parter.
– Content creation and copy experience is a plus.
– Main KPIs include CLV, churn rate and purchase frequency. 

We expect the ideal candidate to have the following experience and traits:

– Data driven CRM work both strategical and operational.
– Customer segmentation and customer data.
– Optimize or other A/B tools.
– Marketing automation.
– Start up mind set.
– Output focused.
– Presentation skills & comfort around higher management.
– Collaborates with peers and cross functional partners to share best practices and develop strategic knowledge.
– Flexible and adaptive to changing priorities with a willingness to learn and improve processes.
– Ability to work independently and with teams interchangeably to deliver results.

This a full-time position, with immediate start, based at the CDLP head office in Stockholm.

Send your CV, Portfolio and a short cover letter to careers@cdlp.com by September 10th.

CDLP is looking for a Web Analyst to join our fast growing, and highly dynamic team at our HQ in Stockholm!  

This is a senior role that’s expected to take full ownership and continuously provide insights and support to the online business.

Successful applicant is problem solver with an analytical mindset. A great passion for data and technical know-how. Forward leaning and a curious mindset. Your work will be central part of shaping the development and success of the site and the company - and you love that type of challenge. 

Key responsibilities:

– Lead and execute tracking and analytics projects.
– Deliver and implement technical tracking solutions using tools such as Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager.
– Arrange workshops to collect business demands for the analytics platform and translate the client’s business goals into a tracking plan with measurable KPI:s.
– Visualise data by setting up dashboards and KPI-reporting.
– Prepare and present in depth analysis reports to management group. 

The ideal candidate:

– Skills and know how of data-driven approaches and processes.
– Extraordinary analytical skills and mindset.
– Attention to detail and strong prioritisation skills in terms of impact.
– A team player who contribute with ideas, feedback and drive to implement.
– High ambition to find and keep up to date with new industry technologies and tools to ensure new opportunities are tested and implemented where appropriate.

Requirements:

– 3 years experience in Analytics role using Google Analytics & Google Tag Manager for web and app.
– Experienced in dashboards and reporting in DataStudio, or other visualisation tools.
– Experience in CRO and A/B-testing.
– Basic experience in BigQuery or a desire to learn.
– Basic HTML, CSS and JavaScript or a desire to learn.
– Fluent Swedish and/or English.
– Experience in other digital marketing is a plus such as SEO and Social.

This a full-time position, with immediate start, based at the CDLP head office in Stockholm.  

Send your CV, Portfolio and a short cover letter to careers@cdlp.com by November 30th.

The role:

This role entails assisting with the day-to-day needs of the development and product team. Tasks will include but not be limited to; sample responsibility, updating our PDM system, measurement of garments, updating m-lists, taking comments during fittings, assisting with order placements for production, quality tasks and assessments.

This is a temporary full-time internship for 6 months starting latest January 2023.

You:

We are looking for a student within textile development / business or similar with an understanding and deep interest of production and product life cycle.

You are positive, reliable, motivated and hands-on. You thrive in a fast-paced environment where flexibility and teamwork is highly valued. You are fluent in English both written and oral.

If it sounds like a good match for you please present yourself by sending an email to our Head of Product Development (Hannan Spasevski) hannan@cdlp.com.
We celebrate the next generation of role models with the Mini Boxer Brief—a scaled-down, limited edition replica of our signature style—for ages 4–10.

For its 2020 resort swimwear collection, CDLP collaborates with Cuixmala, the one-of-its-kind luxury ecological destination set on the Mexican Pacific coast. Celebrating a shared, deep-rooted affinity for responsible practices, the swimwear is crafted from Econyl—an innovative regenerated fibre made from ocean waste.

settings.title: Subscription Explained
settings.text_1: Your subscription is delivered to you every 3 months by free climate compensated home delivery. We have consciously calculated the optimal frequency to reduce excessive shipping and maximize the value for our members. Rest assured, you can speed-up your next delivery if you want it sooner, skip a delivery or cancel and reactivate your subscription at any time.
settings.text_2: As a subscriber, you enjoy exclusive membership pricing with up to 30% off per item. CDLP does not practice price reductions on any core collections. The reduced pricing for subscribers is made possible by the improved forecasting that subscribing customers allow.
settings.text_3: All subscribers enjoy complimentary worldwide DHL Climate Compensated Express Home Delivery. Subscription orders within Sweden are delivered with PostNord Home Delivery or to your nearest PostNord Service Point.
settings.text_4: You can edit quantity, colour, size and style up to 24 hour before your next delivery is shipped. You will receive an email reminder 3 days ahead of your upcoming shipment in case you want to make any edits or top-ups. In case you want your delivery sooner, just choose “Early Renewal” and your next delivery will be shipped right away. You may also skip a delivery, or cancel and re-activate your subscription anytime.
settings.text_5: Simply add top-up products to your subscription deliveries. You enjoy the free climate compensated delivery service on the full order, and help us to reduce excessive shipments.

settings.field_3_text_2: Our T-Shirt collection now includes a new Heavyweight (330 gsm) option providing a richer drape and a heavier feel than the existing Midweight (220 gsm). Both are made of a unique blend of lyocell and pima cotton.

The silk-like softness of our products is spelled lyocell—a future-orientated fibre that is naturally breathable, moisture-wicking, wrinkle-resistant, and quick-drying. Lyocell is sourced from sustainably grown trees that are refined in a closed loop system, and requires less water and land to produce than conventional cotton.

settings.field_1_text: Our Heavy Jersey T-Shirt is designed with a relaxed, straight fit, semi-dropped shoulder and tonal embroidered logo. Made of a recycled and organic cotton blend—lending the garment breathability, durability, and moisture-wicking properties.
settings.field_2_text: Organic cotton is produced and certified to organic agricultural standards. The health of soils and ecosystems are sustained by using natural processes rather than toxic chemicals or GMOs (genetically modified organisms). The production combines tradition and innovation to achieve a strong and versatile fibre. Recycled cotton requires even fewer resources to manufacture, is soft and delicate, and gains durability by being blended with organic cotton.

settings.title: How Automatique Works
settings.text_1: As an Automatique member, you enjoy exclusive membership pricing on all CDLP essentials with up to 33% off. We truly value your loyalty and want to make it simple for you to upgrade your essentials at a beneficial price.
settings.text_2: Your Automatique orders are delivered to you every 3 months. We have consciously calculated the optimal frequency to maximize the value for our members and to reduce excessive shipping. Please note you may speed up your delivery if you wish to get your upcoming order delivered sooner, and you can always skip your next order, cancel and reactivate at any time.
settings.text_3: All Automatique plans include worldwide complimentary DHL Climate Compensated Express Home Delivery. Orders within Sweden are delivered to your nearest DHL Service Point.
settings.text_4: Edit or swap out your Automatique products at any time. Change quantity, colour, size and style to fit your preference and need every 3 months.
settings.text_5: Add one-time products to your upcoming delivery. Choose from all collections and styles.
settings.text_6: Add additional Automatique plans to your existing delivery schedule, or choose a new order date for multiple delivery schedules. This may be handy if you wish to have a plan for a separate address or if you want to gift Automatique for someone else.
settings.text_7: In need of an early refill? You can always speed up your next delivery through the "Order now" button. Your upcoming order will now be delivered as soon as possible, and the following order date will be reset to occur 3 months ahead.
settings.text_8: Edit your shipping and billing addresses at any time to match when moving or traveling.
settings.text_9: Update your payment method at any time. You will also receive a reminder when your active method is about to expire/has expired.

settings.field_3_text_2: The silk-like softness of our underwear is spelled lyocell—a future-orientated fibre that is naturally breathable, moisture-wicking, wrinkle-resistant, and quick-drying. Lyocell is sourced from sustainably grown trees that are refined in a closed loop system, and requires less water and land to produce than conventional cotton.

settings.field_2_text: CDLP was founded in 2016 to revolutionise men’s underwear, launching a new generation of products built with intention and purpose. Today, CDLP is a design house of focused luxury essentials within the categories of underwear, tops, swim and pool, performance, and home. Developed with innovation in Sweden, the line is consciously constructed in Europe using future-orientated materials.
For any inquiries, please email help@cdlp.com.

What is CDLP?

CDLP is a Swedish design company with an expanding line of luxury men’s essentials, hand-crafted in Europe from sustainable, future-oriented fabrics. Read the full story here.


What fabrics are CDLP products made of?

CDLP underwear and t-shirts are made from lyocell, an environmentally friendly and  organic fibre derived from wood pulp. Lyocell is breathable, wicks away moisture from the body while maintaining its shape and colour.

Bamboo socks made from sustainably grown bamboo are spun into a lustrous, flexible yarn, then woven into a strong, breathable fabric with natural anti-bacterial and odor-resistant properties. 

Econyl swimwear is a premium regenerated nylon fibre made from ocean and land fill waste, such as fishing nets, fabric scraps, and carpets. Read more about the production process here.

Where is CDLP underwear made?
Our production is located in a factory in Portugal. All garments are beautifully hand crafted by true textile artisans. Read more about the production here.


How are the CDLP sizes?

Our sizes range from S to XL, with range XS-XXL in our Black single packs. Our garments stay true to size. The fit of our garments are usually snug, so if you prefer your garments on the bigger size, you might want to go up one size. Please find our size guide below.

Denim: (26”-27”)   28”-29”  30”-31”  32”-33”  34”-36”  (37”-38”)

European: (42-44)  44-46  46-48  48-50  50-52  (52-54)

How do I best take care of my CDLP underwear?
The underwear is made of the delicate fabric lyocell, and the best take to take care of your CDLPs is to machine wash warm in no higher than 30-40C/ 105 F, with similar colors. For best durability, do let the garment hang dry. If preferred, warm iron and fold neatly.


How can I stay up to date with the latest CDLP news?

To stay updated with all our latest news, content and exclusive offers please sign up to our newsletter. You can do so by entering your email adress in the footer. 


Where can I buy CDLP?

No matter where you are in the world you can always shop CDLP through our website CDLP.com. Apart from that we have a range of retailers across the world. Find out more information on all our resellers here


I am experiencing technical difficulties on the website. What do I do?

We always aim for the shopping experience on our website to be the very best, but if you were to experience any technical issues please try these tricks:

- Change browser
- Clear your search history
- Relaunch the website

If none of this works, please contact us at help@cdlp.com and specify what the issue is and we will help you with your order.

I want to order, but the item seems to be out of stock. What do I do?

If the item you want is out of stock please contact us at help@cdlp.comand we will try to give you information on when it will get back in stock. Alternatively sign up to our newsletter and you will be able to stay up to date with all latest news and product releases.


I did not get an order confirmation, what do I do?

If you did not receive an order confirmation please drop us an email at help@cdlp.com so we can double check everything is okay with your order, and provide you with your order confirmation info.


Can I change my order after placing it?

If you realize you want to change your order after placing it, please contact us on help@cdlp.com as soon as possible so we can change the order before it gets sent out to you. We cannot guarantee that the change will be possible, it depends on the status of the order and stock availability. If we cannot change your order directly in our system, you are welcome to return it to us once you receive it and we will help you make a change.


Can I cancel my order if I change my mind?

If you want to cancel your order you need to contact us as soon as possible on help@cdlp.com and depending on the status of the order we might be able to cancel it for you. If not, we have a return policy of 14 days and you can read more about the terms and conditions for that here.

Is it safe to order online?

It is our outmost importance that our customers feel safe ordering from us. For your safety, we don’t process any payment information, and only work with the leading payment providers PayPal and Klarna to handle all payments.


How do I pay for my order?

At the checkout you have different options depending on what country you are ordering from. Customers in Scandinavia, the UK and Germany have the possibility to pay through Klarna, where you can choose a range of different payment methods, for example invoice is one of them. All our customers have access to purchasing through Paypal, where you can either pay directly in your account or check out as a guest with your credit card details.


What types of payment do you accept?

We accept different payment methods depending on what country you are in, but for all countries we accept credit card and Paypal. For some countries we also offer payment through Klarna. At check out you will be able to see what payment method is available for you.


I have a voucher/gift card. How do I use it?

If you have a voucher or gift card, you can use it by ticking the box “I have a promo code” at checkout. Enter the code you have received and click Apply. In the unlikely event that the code should not work, this could be that it has been spelled wrong, or that the code has expired. If this problem should occur, please drop us an email at help@cdlp.com and we will do our best to help you.

What is your delivery policy?

All countries within the European Union are shipped on DDP (Delivery Duty Paid) basis, meaning that taxes and duties are included in the final price. For countries outside of the EU the orders are shipped with DDU (Delivery Duty Unpaid) meaning you may be liable to pay tax upon receiving your package. For complete shipping policy for all countries, please have a look here.


Free Worldwide Express Home Delivery on all orders above:

100 USD - United States Dollar
95 EUR - Euro
90 GBP - British Pound
900 SEK - Swedish Krona
1,000 NOK - Norwegian Krone
750 DKK - Danish Krone
150 AUD - Australian Dollar
140 CAD - Canadian Dollar
800 HKD - Hong Kong Dollar
700 CNY - Chinese Renminbi Yuan
11,000 JPY - Japanese Yen


Will I be charged with tax if I order to outside the EU?

For countries outside the EU we ship with DDU, which means it is up to your local customs to decide the amount of tax you need to pay for your order. Please read here the specific information for your shipping destination.


When will I receive my order?

At check out you have the possibility to choose if you want to have your order delivered to your door or to a pick-up point. Depending on what you choose the delivery time might vary. However, we aim to send out all orders the next business day after being placed. However we cannot guarantee the delivery times are exact, but below are guidelines for shipping details:

DHL Express Go Green Climate Compensated Home Delivery is our standard service worldwide. Choose how you prefer to have your package delivered: home, at a pick-up point or an alternative location.

All of Europe 1-2 business days	
US & Canada 1-3 business days	
Rest of the World 1-4 business days

Please note that for orders placed Nov 26-30, estimated delivery times may vary slightly due to high demand.


Can I change my delivery adress after placing the order?

As long as your parcel has not left our warehouse we are able to change the delivery adress, but please double check before placing the order that the adress is correct. If not, try to contact us at help@cdlp.com as soon as possible and we will do our best to help.


How can I track my order?

Once your order ships from our warehouse, you will receive an email with tracking information to the chosen shipping company such as DHL, UPS, PostNord etc.


Where do you ship from?

Our fully automated state-of-the-art warehouse is located in the south of Sweden with excellent connections to international transit terminals for the fastest possible shipping to you.


How do I collect my order?

It depends on what shipping method is used, but the packages are either delivered to your door or to a service point available for pick up. Please read here what is applicable for your package depending on your shipping destination.


My order seems to be lost. What do I do?

We aim for all packages to have a safe journey to you, but despite this packages can get lost on the way. If you suspect this has happened to you, please contact us at help@cdlp.com and we will help you track the package and help you with a replacement order.


I received the wrong order. What do I do?

In the unlikely event that you receive the wrong order please drop us an email at help@cdlp.com and we will help you with an exchange.


I received a faulty item. What do I do?

Of course we aim for a zero tolerance to faulty items being sent out, but if in the unlikely event, this were to happen please contact us directly at help@cdlp.com with a picture of the faulty garment and we will help you proceed with a reclamation and of course compensate you in the best way possible.

Where can I change my account details?

On the account details page in your account you can edit your preferences, such as first name, last name and email address.


How do I reset / change my password?

In case you don’t know your password, use the ”Lost your password?” link on the login page to choose a new one. If you wish to change your password, go to the account details page in your account and fill in your current password to choose a new one. 


Where can I change my default addresses?

On the addresses page in your account you can change your shipping and billing address. These addresses are saved for future purchases.


Where can I view my orders?

On the order history page in your account you can view your past and current orders. If you have previous orders that are not included in the order history, please contact us at help@cdlp.com. 


How do I track my orders?

A link to track your orders are always included in the shipping confirmation. You can also track your orders trough the order history in your account. The tacking will be available as soon as the order is dispatched from our warehouse.

Where do I send my return?

If you wish to make a return, please contact us at help@cdlp.com and we will provide you with all the details you need.


What is your return policy?

We offer free returns on all purchases. We have a general return policy of 30 days after receiving the package. In order for your return to be accepted the package has to be sealed. Shipping costs related to the original order of the returned product/-s will not be refunded. If a replacement product/-s is to be sent out, CDLP will cover the shipping cost for this product/-s. After having received your return, you will be refunded as soon as possible. 


I have returned a product. When will I receive my refund?

We aim to refund you as soon as we receive your return, but the very latest within 30 days after having received the return.


I used a voucher on the order I wish to return. What will happen to it?

When we register your refund we will re-activate your voucher and send it out to you again, so you can use it on another order.

AUTOMATIQUE IS CURRENTLY DOWN FOR MAINTENANCE. CONTACT US AT MEMBERS@CDLP.COM.

What is Automatique? 

Automatique is our subscription service. Join for automatic delivery of essentials every three months. Automatique gives you better pricing and complimentary shipping.


What styles are available for Automatique?

3 × Boxer Brief
3 × Boxer Trunk
3 × Y-Brief
3 × Boxer Shorts
Crew-Neck T-Shirt
V-Neck T-Shirt
5 × Mid-Length Socks
3 × Low-Cuts Socks

When will my Automatique orders be delivered?

The delivery times for Automatique are the same as for one-time purchases. The Automatique orders are placed every three months, starting the day of your first order. On the My Automatique page in your account you can view the date you signed up and became a member, the date of your last Automatique and the date of your next Automatique. Note that these are order dates and the time of delivery will be a few days later. See the delivery times in the delivery section here in the FAQ. 


What payment methods are available for Automatique?

At this moment credit card is the only payment method offered for Automatique orders. The total of your Automatique plan will be drawn from your card every three months, starting the day of your first order.


Can I cancel my Automatique plan?

Yes, in case you no longer want your underwear drawer updated with Automatique, you are free to cancel at any time. On the bottom of the My Automatique page in your account, choose ”Cancel Automatique plan” and confirm your decision to end your membership.


Where do I view my Automatique orders?

On the My Automatique page in your account every Automatique plan has its own order history where you can view and track your previous Automatique orders. In the standard order history you can view and track all your orders, including one-time purchases. 


Can I combine Automatique products and non-Automatique products in the same order?

Yes, if you wish to purchase other products at the same time as signing up for Automatique, simply add all the desired products to the bag and proceed with your purchase. Voucher code discounts will only apply to the non-Automatique products. 


If you have any other questions regarding Automatique, please contact us at members@cdlp.com.

settings.field_1_text_2: In the Studio with Gustaf Nordenskiöld
settings.field_3_text_2: Gustaf Nordenskiöld is an artist, designer and curator. His ceramic work revolves around memories of objects and time, existing in the space between recognition, ambiguity, figuration, and abstraction. The production process is often visible in his finished work, leaving traces in the object, as a memory of its making. Gustaf works from his studio located in a former industrial area in Örnsberg, Stockholm, often in the company of his dog Effe.

settings.field_1_text_1: MY WHOLE LIFE I HAVE DONE NOTHING BUT INTERPRET MY DREAMS OF ULTIMATE MASCULINITY, AND DRAW THEM.—TOM OF FINLAND
settings.byline_text_2: Tom of Finland (Touko Laaksonen, Finnish, 1920—1991), is the creator of some of the most iconic, unrestrained, and readily recognizable imagery of contemporary gay culture. He is regarded as one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.

settings.field_2_text: CDLP presents a design collaboration with Tom of Finland Foundation–the non-profit archive dedicated to the preservation and promotion of Tom of Finland’s body of work and the erotic arts since 1984. Studying the work of the artist, CDLP noted that the underwear–a fashion feature seen throughout his hedonistic liberation, and in effect designed by Tom of Finland–had never been directly conceived into reality. These very depictions provided the design inspiration behind a limited edition Jock Strap and Tanga Brief. Each style is accompanied by a portrait of the artist as a limited edition print, and presented in a custom box featuring some of Tom’s most iconic work.

settings.field_1_text: Tom’s influence on fashion and imprint on popular culture is undeniable. Designers that include Jean-Paul Gaultier, Tom Ford and Helmut Lang have been influenced by his work. This collaboration marks how fantasy can come to life.—Durk Dehner, co-founder of Tom of Finland Foundation.

settings.field_2_text: Organic cotton is produced and certified to organic agricultural standards. The health of soils and ecosystems are sustained by using natural processes rather than toxic chemicals or GMOs (genetically modified organisms). The production combines tradition and innovation to achieve a strong and versatile fibre. Recycled cotton requires even fewer resources to manufacture, is soft and delicate, and gains durability by being blended with organic cotton.

Our Mobilité underwear is crafted from rPET (recycled polyethylene terephthalate), a strong and durable material that is made through recycling existing plastic materials. The fibre is moisture wicking, quick-drying and anti-odor.

Our luminous, polychromatic plain-weave Swim Trunk is designed with a regular fit and a mid-thigh leg. Made from Econyl—a regenerated nylon fibre made from salvaged plastic waste from oceans and landfills.

Our underwear is crafted from lyocell—a future-oriented fibre sourced from the wood pulp of sustainably grown trees. Lyocell fibres are smooth, elastic, and have a natural breathability, which makes the fabric extremely soft to the skin.

This season introduces two new swimwear styles: Swim Trunks and Deck Shorts, joining the Swim Brief and Swim Shorts. settings.field_1_text: Australian born photographer Akila Berjaoui is the fourth collaborator in CDLP LENSED BY—an ongoing photography series featuring guest artists.
settings.field_2_text: Berjaoui traveled to Hydra Island, Greece to document the story that features CDLP swimwear over the course of one week. Alternating shots between a Minolta and Contax G2, male sensuality is delicately captured against a hazy backdrop of sun-drenched cliffs, clear blue skies, and the inky Myrtoan Sea. See more of Akila's work on @akila_berjaoui.

settings.text_1: “THE SUBJECT, SWANN FINES, I AM LUCKY ENOUGH TO CALL MY BOYFRIEND AND PARTNER IN LIFE—SO THE EXPERIENCE OF SHOOTING WAS INTIMATE AND EXPLORATORY. I LOVE TO DOCUMENT MY JOURNEYS BY CAPTURING THE 'IN BETWEEN' MOMENTS, THE SENSUALITY OF THE MALE AND FEMALE FORM, AND UNSUSPECTING BATHING BEAUTIES.”—AKILA BERJAOUI

settings.field_1_text: “Akila has a unique way of capturing colors and dreamy atmospheres, creating tales that are truly aspirational. While the subjects are normally women, I was curious to see how masculine energy would translate through Akila's lens. The result is sensual and vulnerable—yet also evokes this exciting, intimate feeling about summer. It is impossible to not let your mind wander to balmy, summer times.”—Christian Larson, Artistic Director

settings.field_3_text_2: Reinforcing CDLP’s ongoing commitment to working with sustainable fabrics, each swim style is made with Econyl—a regenerated premium nylon fibre. Econyl is made by recovering nylon waste from oceans and landfills, such as fishing nets from the oceans, fabric scraps from mills and carpets destined for landfill. Through a radical regeneration and purification process, the nylon waste is recycled right back to its original purity. Econyl has has the potential to be recycled infinitely, without ever losing its quality.

settings.field_1_text: Rasmus Weng Karlsen is the third collaborator in LENSED BY—a photography series exploring nuances of masculinity not typically represented in the men’s underwear industry.
settings.field_2_text: The Danish self-taught photographer, represented by Bad Land, shot Daniel Hopwood from Manchester agency Brother at Grand Hotel Copenhagen. The campaign launches the spring 2019 season featuring styles from the CDLP collection, and coincides with Illum, Copenhagen launching the brand in-store. Rasmus follows fellow Scandinavians The Rencks (film director Johan Renck and wife Elin) and Daniella Midenge to collaborate in the project. Christian Larson, CDLP creative director says, “Rasmus’ images never feel like a shoot, they have that pure authenticity—like you’re invited into moments of his life. He has a unique ability to show vulnerability alongside grit, humor, and understated cool—all at the same time. Through this campaign, Rasmus has injected a fresh element of masculinity into CDLP. This is the intention of LENSED BY: —to represent modern conscious masculinity in all its unbiased forms. These images really are some my favorite of Rasmus’ to-date.”

settings.field_1_text: DANIEL WAS PERFECT TO SHOOT BECAUSE HE ISN’T A “TYPICAL” MEN’S UNDERWEAR MODEL. HIS ENERGY MADE THIS PROJECT SO RAW AND FUN—EVEN WHEN WEARING ONLY A PAIR OF BOXERS IN MINUS DEGREE TEMPERATURES OUTSIDE.—RASMUS WENG KARLSEN

settings.field_2_text: Mobilité is sportswear essentials built for well-being. The outer layer re-interprets classic sport staples in robust fabrics, while the technical inner layer is designed for physical performance. The collection is made of organic, regenerated and recycled materials.

settings.field_3_text_2: Heavy Terry is our re-interpretation of the loopback knit fabric used in classic athletic wear, characterised by loops on the inside and a smooth outer surface. The loops allow air to circulate, and also wick moisture efficiently. Made in a robust 550 gsm weight, in a unique blend of recycled and organic cotton, ensuring the garments maintain shape and comfort.

settings.field_2_text: Our Mobilité underpinnings are crafted from rPET (recycled polyethylene terephthalate), a strong and durable material that is made through recycling existing plastic materials. The fibre is moisture wicking, quick-drying and anti-odor.

settings.field_3_text_2: Born in Spånga, Sweden, Dolph Lundgren is an actor, director, producer and martial artist. He is a former European champion in karate (1980–81), and holds a master’s degree in chemical engineering. While studying in Sydney in 1982, he met Grace Jones. The two dated and moved to New York City and became a couple of the now, frequently portrayed at Studio 54 in company of their acquaintances Andy Warhol, Keith Haring, Iman, and Steve Rubell. His breakthrough in film came when he was cast in Rocky IV (1985) as the Soviet boxer Ivan Drago against Sylvester Stallone.

settings.field_1_text: RENDEZ-VOUS AT HOTEL LA SUITE WITH FRANÇOIS-XAVIER DUSSOL
settings.field_2_text: Far away from the PR-machinery, award ceremonies and list mania there are hoteliers that work silently under the radar, relying more on word of mouth than glossy magazine rankings. François-Xavier Dussol is that hotelier. Falling in love with Rio over a decade ago, he left his secure job as a banker and moved permanently from Paris to set up Rio’s first boutique hotel, La Maison, and, more recently, La Suite—what might be the world’s most loveable hotel.

settings.field_1_text: More of a guesthouse rather than a conventional hotel
settings.field_2_text: La Suite sits on a narrow peninsula outside of Rio de Janeiro in the haven Joá. It´s 7 rooms are styled with Dussol´s unique blend of contemporary and classic Gallic elegance, imbued with Brazilian passion. Secluded paradis Joatinga beach – called “The jewel of Rio” – is 10 minutes walk from the hotel’s gate and the panoramic view from the terrace beats every postcard you have ever seen.

settings.field_1_text:
COCOON IN LOS ANGELES 
WITH JONAS ÅKERLUND
settings.field_2_text: ​When starting CDLP, we had a vision to portray men that have the courage to follow their dreams—men who inspire us. A man who embodies this definition of modern masculinity is Jonas Åkerlund—a trailblazer with a timeless and iconic personal style.

settings.title: Banner 3/4
settings.text_1: With his distinctive storytelling and visually driven signature style that often pushes the boundaries of the status quo, Jonas Åkerlund is an internationally awarded director of music videos, commercials, documentaries, stage shows and feature films. Most famous for his work with Madonna, Prodigy, Metallica, Beyonce, Rolling Stones, Lady Gaga and Paul McCartney, Jonas has made his distinct mark on the film, music and art scene for the past 20 years.

settings.title: Banner 3/4
settings.text_1: I WAS ALWAYS A VAMPIRE. I JUST FIND PEACE OF MIND LIVING IN A DARK ENVIRONMENT.—JONAS ÅKERLUND

settings.field_1_text: CREATIVITY IS A VERY MYSTERIOUS, QUIXOTIC, LITTLE ANIMAL YOU HAVE TO CATCH.—STING

settings.field_2_text: is a rare short film portrait of the iconic artist STING, presented by CDLP. Shot at his Tuscan home against a backdrop of hazy summer and the acoustics of nature, CDLP co-founder and filmmaker Christian Larson chronicles Sting's perspective on creativity, masculinity, and love.

In celebration of an iconic recreational destination on the edge of Lake Como, CDLP collaborates with Grand Hotel Tremezzo on a limited edition swimwear collection, launching exclusively with Mr. Porter and at CDLP.com.

Inspired by the lifestyle at the acclaimed destination, the capsule features three styles each specifically designed for varying occasions at the property: an Aperitivo Swim Short, Piscina Swim Short, and Riva Swim Brief. The palette is directly inspired by the prominent shades of the surroundings, aptly named Bellagio Blue, Como Blue, Navy Blue, Tremezzo Orange, and Optic White. Reinforcing CDLP's ongoing commitment to working with innovative sustainable fabrics, each style is made with Econyl—a regenerated premium nylon fibre made from fishnets and nylon waste. All fabrics are sourced from Italy and garments are handmade in Portugal at a family-run fábrica.

Grand Hotel Tremezzo is located at the heart of Lake Como, with unparalleled views of Bellagio and the majestic Grigne mountains. This landmark destination—which sits adjacent to Villa Carlotta’s famed gardens—is an authentic Art Nouveau luxury palace offering an unparalleled warm welcome, and is the recipient of several accolades including the Condé Nast Traveler Reader’s Choice Award and Gold List 2018; European Hotel Hotel of the Year Award; and Haute Grandeur Best Luxury Hotel Award.

settings.field_1_text_2: SÉBASTIAN TELLIER and CDLP are an apropos marriage. While both hold an individualistic style, "Home" coincidentally follows Mr. Tellier’s 2020 "Domesticated"-record—the title of which was suggested by friend and director Sofia Coppola to describe his new status as a father assigned to domestic tasks instead of owning stages around the globe. Shot in a characteristic Parisian "maison" by photographer Jonas Unger, the campaign puts the capsule to test as it captures Mr. Tellier making breakfast, playing the piano, barbecuing and taking his car for errands.

settings.field_1_text: Traditionally a sanctuary for recharge, the home has gained status over the past years, and for many has become the central location for work today. Blurring a line between loungewear and ready-to-wear and closing a gap between indoor and outdoor dressing, Home is luxurious comfort met with directional design. Consciously crafted in Portugal, the capsule includes a Short Suit and Long Suit in Burgundy, Black and Navy Blue, and a Robe in Burgundy and Black, all developed in the brand’s signature lyocell—a modern, ultra breathable cellulose fiber that is supremely soft and moisture-wicking. Sourced from sustainably grown wood which is refined in a closed-loop system where 99% of the nontoxic solvent used is recycled, lyocell requires less water and land to produce than cotton.

settings.field_1_text_1:
“WE ARE LONG TIME FANS OF SÉBASTIEN TELLIER’S MUSIC, CREATIVITY, AND ICONIC DRESSING. HE TRULY EMBODIES THE CDLP WORLD OF STYLE, CHARACTER, AND JOIE DE VIVRE. JONAS (UNGER) HAS AN INNATE ABILITY TO CAPTURE CHARACTERISTIC FIGURES THROUGH HIS LENS. HERE, HE MANAGED TO DOCUMENT THE COLLECTION IN THE PERFECT CONTEXT WHILE PROFILING MR. TELLIER IN A NATURAL ENVIRONMENT. ALL WHILE MAKING EVERYDAY MUNDANE CHORES ALL A BIT MORE EXCITING WHILE WEARING HOME.”
—Christian Larson, Creative Director.

settings.field_1_text: 'Valentine Love', the first installment in CDLP LENSED BY, a series of photo collaborations by distinguished creatives from around the world.
settings.field_2_text: CDLP co-founder and film director Christian Larson had a concept to photograph a couple for the underwear company's Valentine’s Day campaign, and turned to real-life couple, fellow Swedish film director Johan Renck and his wife Elin Renck. ‘Valentine Love’ was shot in the Renck’s Brooklyn home they share with their four children. During a (suitably apt) date-night drinking a bottle of wine, Johan photographed Elin and Elin photographed Johan, both wearing the signature black CDLP Boxer Briefs.

settings.field_1_text:
UPGRADE TO LYOCELL 
WITH MATERIAL CULTURE
settings.field_2_text: The luxurious silk-like softness and superior comfort of our underwear is spelled Lyocell. Lyocell is an extremely breathable cellulose fabric; naturally anti-bacterial, wicks moisture away from the body, while maintaining both its shape and color, wash after wash. Material Culture—an izikhothane dance collective from Johannesburg—explores the benefits of the Lyocell fabric in this video directed by Christian Larson.
OF LYOCELL FIBERS ARE SMOOTHER THAN THE SURFACES OF MODAL, COTTON AND WOOL, REDUCING SKIN IRRITATION.
THERE IS NO NEED FOR FABRIC SOFTENER OR BLEACH, AND ENERGY AND WATER USE CAN BE DECREASED DUE TO SHORTER WASHING MACHINE CYCLES.

settings.byline_text: Crew members Kabelo and John Bravo wearing Boxer Trunk in Army Green and White.

settings.field_2_text: TO THE PERFORMANCE OF LYOCELL, WHICH IS THE FIRST CELLULOSE FIBER TO USE THIS NANOTECHNOLOGY. THE NANOFIBRILS ARE OPTIMIZED TO ABSORB MOISTURE, WITH EXCELLENT COOLING PROPERTIES. BY CONTRAST, SYNTHETIC FIBERS DO NOT ABSORB MOISTURE.

settings.field_3_text_2: Material Culture is a Johannesburg based izikhothane dance collective that celebrates art, fashion and dance over superficial materialism. Intrigued by their rebellion rooted in a somewhat youthful innocence, CDLP creative director Christian Larson noted a non-conformist parallel between the philosophy of Material Culture and CDLP–and an opportunity to put Lyocell to the test through their dance.

settings.field_3_text_2:
Made from recycled fibres and crafted with the same quality and precision as our core collection, Mobilité features technical enhancements for movement, versatility, and high-performance output across the board. The world’s resources are limited; your own potential is not.

“Best Performance Underwear”
—GQ Fitness Awards 2020

Our Mobilité underwear is crafted from rPET (recycled polyethylene terephthalate), a strong and durable material that is made through recycling existing plastic materials. The fibre is moisture wicking, quick-drying and anti-odor.

settings.field_1_text_2:
In-his-own-words, Dolph Lundgren is "actor, director, producer, martial artist, chemical engineer, and father of two beautiful daughters". Publicly, he is best known for his role as imposing Soviet boxer Ivan Drago in Rocky IV (1985). His physique, the Stallone franchise, and an intriguing stoicism captured a global audience.

Behind the muscles and build was a young man who was coming into his own—identifying his character and values in a business characterized by ego. In and out of the ring, his stance was to stay grounded. Martial arts, a practice that he’d been religiously studying and mastering since his early teens, provided a foundation to face each day with integrity and purpose. Training today is more than his physical being; it’s about strengthening his body by way of the mind with laser-sharp focus and commitment to bettering himself.

We sat down with Dolph at his villa Casa Amarillo in Spain, where he turns the needle introspectively to talk about resilience, philosophy, and rewriting the script that defined his alpha male on-screen persona.

settings.field_1_text: CDLP: How has your martial arts training affected your personality? DL: Martial arts were—and still are—everything to me, from the age 14 or 15, well even today. I came from a tough upbringing and my dad was abusive to me and my mom. I was always kind of crushed by him, probably because I reminded him of himself in some way… my way out was through martial arts. To try to feel like I was worth something—that's why I started. I became attracted to the philosophy behind it all. It has to do with bigger issues and how you look at your life. When I turned 30 and eventually got into the movie business, I became sidetracked and stopped competing but I always maintained training. Even today, when I go back to Sweden, I see the same dojo. I train with the same guys, well, they're not all there but some of them are, and my instructor's the same guy. It's been a part of my personality, and part of my life.
settings.field_2_text:
CDLP: Beyond your physique, what has martial arts given you in terms of character? What have you gained when it comes to your mind and soul?

DL: You get a feeling of not giving up, of always getting back up. And it's not how hard you hit but it's how hard you can get hit and still get up. That's the guy who's gonna win the fight.

You learn to respect other people and also you see your own limitations so you become quite accepting of other people and you become more peaceful in one way. Because, you know, there's always somebody who can beat you up. Kick your ass somewhere. And you know that it gives you humility as a person… If you're an asshole in the dojo, you're gonna get your ass kicked sooner or later. So, you learn to be respectful and you learn about your own weaknesses and strengths.

settings.title: Banner 3/4
settings.text_1: Lensed by Jonas Unger in Spain, 2021.

settings.field_1_text: CDLP: You have this interesting contrast, where your characters have been this extremely tough guy, but getting to know you, even a little, you are respectful and a soft, genuine soul. DL: I could have been probably more destructive if I hadn't taken up martial arts. Because I had a lot of pain from my childhood, from the way I was treated, and, a lot of self loathing, a lot of not feeling confident. Not liking myself. And I think I could have easily continued the cycle of violence.
settings.field_2_text: It’s a journey and you learn things all the time. When you’re 25 years old, you think you’re grown up. When you’re 45, you look back and realize how naive you were. In my life, I always like to learn new things, but the values have always stayed the same. I always knew what felt right. The problem is it gets difficult to hold onto those values in our world. You’re always dealing with egos and narcissists and those who want to bring negativity your way—it’s a struggle.

settings.field_1_text: “A real man has to be emotional and in touch with oneself.”

CDLP: What you're describing now is a transformation, for you, but also a transformation of how to be a good man in general. Have you changed your idea about the definition of ‘good masculinity’? DL: It's a journey, and you learn things all the time. You know when you're 35 you think you're grown up, and then you realize that when you were 35 you were a kid. When you're 45 you think, oh no, I'm over 40, and then when you're 50, you realize, well, I could have done things differently. I was still kind of naïve. When you're dealing with people who are, you know, narcissistic, egotistical, and mean—they try to destroy you. They try to pull you into the dark side, to negativity. But I had to struggle within myself to always feel like I'm honest. I am respectful of people and do the right thing. I don't have to go to bed regretting something I'd done, or feeling guilty.
settings.field_2_text:
You have to be in touch with your emotions. [Men] have this aggressive part of us that we’re always trying to assert ourselves, to make more money. A real man has to be emotional and in touch with oneself. A good man is reliable. A good man is by your side.

Who would you want in a fox hole next to you when the enemy is about to attack? I want that guy. You don’t want him to run. You want him to help you, you want him to be tough, but caring and understanding. It’s a blend that in my view, all good men should have.

settings.field_1_text: CDLP: You work out continuously. How is that connected to your mind? Has your relationship between body and mind changed over the years? DL: Look, training is meditative and it's healing because I can relax and I don't have to think about business. I do it for myself to feel good. But what I've changed lately is I don't do it to prove anything anymore, really. Only up until five years ago I was still doing crazy stuff. Like trying to out lift somebody or try to spar with a young guy—to show off. Trying to live up to something.
settings.field_2_text:
But now I don't feel I have to live up to it. I mean, I have to live up to it a little bit… But I don't punish myself as much as I used to. Which is a great feeling.

Like they say, if you walk into a gym, 80% of the people lift with their ego… It's much better to lift from your mind… Lately that's what's happened to me. I use it to relax, to stay healthy, and to look good for the films. I don't have to overdo anything or to outdo anybody.

settings.field_1_text: CDLP: So it’s not so much about being the best anymore? DL: I've been on this strange journey in my life because I've played the alpha male. Always about winning, about beating the opposition—winning the fight. Taking out the bad guys. Whatever it is. But, inside my journey was about trying to find myself, I didn't really realize that.. I was just going on in this fog. Film after film, and workout after workout. But it was really about trying to be happy and be relaxed, and feel like I love myself. I don't have to have the external world tell me so. But it comes from the inside. That took me a long time to figure out because for many years I didn't like myself at all. And I think that was really tough, for sure.
settings.field_2_text:
CDLP: And how are you feeling now?

DL: I feel very lucky that I pulled this off. I came from this little town in Sweden, Spånga, and then moved up north to this even smaller town… Amidst all the craziness of Studio 54, drinking, and partying, and movies... good movies, bad movies, really bad movies, really good movies. Somehow I came out of it sort of okay.

settings.field_2_text_2: An eclectic mix curated for spring metamorphosis.

settings.field_1_text_2: Underwear isn’t one-size-fits-all. Nor is it one-style-fits-all-occasions. Expand your horizons. Perfection is pairing a Y-Brief with a vintage YSL briefcase; luxury is a long, lazy weekend in nothing but Boxer Shorts. Variety is the spice of life; rigidity is its ruin.
settings.field_2_text_2: UNDERSTUDIES
settings.field_3_text_2:
Words by Zeb Goodman
Imagery by Tomas Carlsten

settings.field_1_text_2:
Sunday Service
Stanley, 43, Trinity Church, NYC
settings.field_3_text_2: –When I was a kid I saw my dad in his tighty-whities and swore I’d never commit such a sartorial sin. I wore boxer shorts for thirty years until my own son was born. Then I decided it was time to branch out. For church Sundays, I pray in my “mighty-whities.” They’re the ultimate fatherhood flex.

settings.field_1_text_2:
Saturday Shift
Conrad, 64, Dept. of Public Works, Queens, NYC
settings.field_3_text_2: –In the army we had only one option of underwear, we just called them ‘shorts.’ They were white at first, but that attracted too much attention when we hung them up to dry, so the army began dying them green. Now I like to have options. I’ve got all kinds and colours back home. For my shifts, I wear boxer briefs.

settings.field_1_text_2:
Site Inspection
Jeff, 45, San Francisco, California
settings.field_3_text_2: –I’m always traveling for work, which effectively means I live out of my suitcase. I’m usually a boxer shorts kind of guy, but when travelling, boxer trunks take up less space. On the other hand, when stuffing my backpack for hikes, I opt for y-briefs. Every inch matters.

settings.field_1_text_2:
Letting Loose
Paulie, 13, North Caldwell, New Jersey
settings.field_3_text_2: –I like being loose, being laid-back. I like boxer shorts. I wear them with my track pants when I’m at school. When I get home I take my track pants off, I let loose. I choose boxer shorts.

settings.field_1_text_2:
Business Meetings
Patrick, 27, American Gardens Building, Upper West Side, NYC
settings.field_3_text_2: –I believe in taking care of myself, a balanced diet and a rigorous exercise routine. Each morning, I put on a pair of boxer trunks to do my stomach crunches. I can do a thousand now.

settings.field_1_text_2:
Graduation Day
Pete, 18, Cornell University, New York
settings.field_3_text_2: –I’m graduating today. I’ve got my suit on to take photos with the fam, but when I gown-up to get my diploma this afternoon, you better believe I’ll be strutting across that stage with nothing but boxer shorts on underneath.

–I normally wear boxer trunks. I like that they don’t show above the belt. On weekends I live in Levi’s 501s, and nothing beats a crisp new pair of y-briefs. That’s old-school class. You can’t change that.

settings.field_3_text_2: The airy lightness and natural drape of our Pool collection come from Ecovero; a premium viscose fibre derived from wood pulp. Manufactured only from certified and controlled wood sources, and produced with significantly lower fossil energy use and water than generic viscose, Ecovero is certified with the internationally recognised EU Ecolabel. This label of environmental excellence is only awarded to products and services, which have a significantly lower environmental impact throughout their lifecycle: from raw material extraction to production, distribution and disposal.

Chosen for its tactile and flexible qualities, the fabric works alongside your body offering unrestricted movement, a streamlined shape and much needed support. rPet—knitted in two different ways to enhance its natural properties—is not only naturally moisture-wicking and quick drying but also has anti-odor properties making it the ideal fabrication for even the most intense workouts. Photographer Yaniv Edry is the fifth collaborator in CDLP LENSED BY—an ongoing photography series featuring guest artists. Shot at Rosh HaNikra (translates to "top of the grotto" in Hebrew), situated on the northern Israel coastline, Yaniv documents the CDLP swimwear collection on 35mm film.

settings.byline_text: Meitar wears Swim Shorts in Maya Blue

settings.field_3_text_2: Yaniv Edry is an Israeli photographer who began his path documenting his family and friends at an early age. His work features natural compositions; each shot, a sculpture of space. His raw storytelling style depicts a live, unplanned quality of reportage—focusing on human emotion with a tendency to walk a delicate boundary between reality and imagination.

settings.field_2_text: Reinforcing CDLP’s ongoing commitment to working with sustainable fabrics, each swim style is made with Econyl—a regenerated premium nylon fibre. Econyl is made by recovering nylon waste from oceans and landfills, such as fishing nets from the oceans, fabric scraps from mills and carpets destined for landfill. Through a radical regeneration and purification process, the nylon waste is recycled right back to its original purity. Econyl has has the potential to be recycled infinitely, without ever losing its quality.

The loops allow air to circulate, and also wick moisture efficiently.
